Text: Saint Moluag (c. 510–592; also known as "Lua", "Luan", "Luanus", "Lugaidh", "Moloag", "Molluog", "Molua", "Murlach", "Malew") was a Scottish missionary, and a contemporary of Saint Columba, who evangelized the Picts of Scotland in the sixth century.
